review_blob:
Small bomber size bottle from the brewery. Fetish is one of those rare breweries that is extremely small in size (just above home brew) but makes exceptional beers. In my mind submissive is one of their best. All of their beers are live, with lots of yeast and no filter. Very murky,which gives it incredible flavor. I don't think these would keep very long and they're meant to drink extremely fresh. But this is one of the best IPAs I've had in my life, and if you get the opportunity to drink one that's fresh I'm sure you will agree.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

16 ounce can from the fridge Lancaster. Pours a light orange with light medium head. Not much aroma on opening. Bottom of can has cryptic numbers, no use by date(boo). A nice full-bodied bitter slightly oily hop flavor. Hard to tell how old this is. Good, but nothing exceptional

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

growler from fridge. I would have pegged this as an XPA given the ABV . Great grapefruit nose and strong hop presence - more hop oil than most. clean crisp hop flavor with some overpowering bitterness. very good.

12 ounce can. Best by April 20 2016 so this beer is just about past its prime. Pours a medium golden slightly brown. Really really nice hoppy aroma. Flavor of dank hops. Slightly heavy. Almost sour. I would have liked to have tasted this beer right after it was canned because it may have been better, but this one was mediocre.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle enjoy by May 1, 2016. Pour is a orangey brown with creamy head. Not much aroma. This "reduced-gluten" beer seems to me to be a fad but I like new Belgian products so I tried it nevertheless. It's interesting to consider whether the removal of gluten affects the taste. There's a nice hop presence to this Pale ale, but it drops off at the end with a certain thinness. Not bad but there are much better pale ales out there, and whether or not the contain gluten is of no interest to me.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle. It's not really fair to rate a wet hopped IPAA in April. But I will anyway. Too heavy on the malt. Destroys the wet hop cleanliness. Decent, but not great. Heavy-handed indeed.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Two Brothers Heavy Handed Wet Hopped IPA (Chinook)

review_blob: Can from Bevmo in Santa Barbara. Canned on 2-16 (3 weeks ago) lively floral aroma on opening the can and pouring into class. light yellow color with nice head. delicious fresh, pinely complex, somewhat spicy taste with nice hop oil on tongue. very light and bright IPA, and one that is tough to beat, especially this fresh. extremely highly recommended.
beer_name: Firestone Walker Luponic Distortion Revolution No. 001

review_blob: six back purchased as gas station santa barbara. very nice citrus aroma on pour. taste is slight bitter aftertaste that recedes as beer warms up. banana, sprucey resin. Pretty good.
On Tap at Wildwood Kitchen, santa Barbara. On of the most aromatic beers I have had. excellent! fresh citrus resin. great grassy hoppy nice bitterness. very highly recommended.

Stone enjoy after 12.26.15. Poured a murky orange with very fluffy white head that dissipates extremely slowly. My experiences did not mimic other reviewers as the extremely harsh bitterness of the IPAA overwhelmed everything else and there is an extremely unpleasant bitter aftertaste. Very and I normally like very bitter beer! Unfortunatelyi'm going to have to pour this one. It might be the way that it was maintained at different temperatures. In and out of the refrigerator so possibly my fault.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can from the Greek, Lancaster PA. Pours a mediium light clear orange-yellow with white head. Very smooth and oily, with a quite bitter finish. lots of hops and resin. i am always pleased with the beers offered by two brothers. i like the pale ale better - not that this is bad, just that the pale is superb. the oily finish is a nice touch for an IPA in a can . recommmended

I usually don't like IPAs flavored with fruit. I usually don't like darker color IPAs. But I'm going to make an exception here. Stone has done it again. I found the peaches to be subtle but yet slightly take the edge off of the bitterness of the IPAs in a way that I have never experienced before. Yes this beer is somewhat of a meal unto itself but just like a slice of delicious peach pie it satisfies. Don't get me wrong the peaches don't overwhelm and it's not too sweet everything is just the way it should be. A very nicely done by PA with peaches

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Stone / 4 Hands / Bale Breaker Sorry Not Sorry

review_blob:
Bottle from whole foods Santa Barbara . Pours clear golden yellow. Aroma of a lager. Bitter slightly sour. No real wet hop display. No green flavor, very disappointing, especially at this price point. I really wanted to like this beer, and am crazy about wet hop, but unfortunately one of the least enjoyable bland varieties of wet hop I have had.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 oz bomber from whole foods SB. Pours clear yellow that becomes more cloudy as it warms up. Fresh hop aroma upon bottle opening . Fresh fruit-filled hop flavor that blossoms as it warms. At 5.5 Abv this is a much more flavorful session IPA than the 4-5% ers that tend to be overly dry and harsh . This session beer actually tops more fuller bodied Brews and I can see why it won GABF bronze for a session ale. Delicious and highly recommended 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

$10 bottle wrapped in burlap. Good marketing but how is the beer? Billed as "wet hop". - how green will it taste? Pours a clear golden yellow, not much aroma. Flavor is weak for a wet hop, more hype than hop, unfortunately. Not much wet flavor, somewhat weak hop flavor. I would not have known this was a wet hop. It's not the relatively low IPA Abv of 6%, I tasted much more wet hop in a 5% session wet hop. Not bad but nothing special and definitely not worth $10. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber from whole
Foods Santa Barbara - no dates so I have no idea when bottled - pours a lighter yellow - ok aroma but I expected more - nice hoppy citrus flavor with malt in background just like I like it. A good but not great IPA - would like to taste this fresh from brewery

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

16 oz can 75 days old from Costco in Cali - pours light gold - pure hops no malt just the way I like it uh huh uh huh. Very nice IPA in a can I just found out aM Bev now owns golden road but the price was Right at Costco I am embarrassed to say. Otherwise fight the power of am Bev ! F you corporate shill!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Golden Road Heal the Bay IPA

review_blob:
6 pack cans. Pours clear orange. Ok aroma of hops. Really nice pine bitter flavor. Fresh flavor. Nice light balance of malt. One of best iPas I've had in a can. I would definitely buy a sixer of it was available in Cali or pa!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 oz bomber. Pours dark gold. Not great aroma, but very nice citrus hop
Flavor. Not much malt, lots of pepper. Very nice fresh brew. Recommended

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Flat Tail Rough Cut India Pale Ale

review_blob:
22 ounce bomber. Pours a weak yellow. Little aroma . Bready and decent flavor but ends really bitter, and not in a good way. Beer brewed 60 days ago, but I wonder if it sat in a hot warehouse too long. I'd probably rate it better fresh as I think the bitterness may go away

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber from hood river grocery - kind of muddy - just ok - tastes a bit old.id try at
Brewery but nothing special

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice yellow pour. Great hop aroma. 22 oz. bomber purchased in hood river . Very fresh taste. Perfect (to this palate) light malt that does not overpower the the delicious bold hop flavor. Very well done and recommended

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
on tap at brewery. not much aroma. harsh astringent home brew palate, light-medium bitterness without a clean hop taste. pretty strong malt base. Needs some work.

Bomber from the fridge, Lancaster pa. Pours an unfiltered cloudy yellow, Nice for a Pilsner! Rogue beers always have a unique flavor to me. I can never quite put my finger on it, but I know it when I taste it. This Pilsner has lots of flavor and personality. The usual straw Pilsner taste with a bit of hops in the background, but the unfiltered nature gives it an extra flavor that is hard to quantify. Recommended 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz can from the fridge, Lancaster pa. Respectable go-to pilsner, the usual straw with very modest hop backbone. Not in the league of local's victory prima pils or Troegs sunshine pils IMO, but better than most. Clean and refreshing 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pints at Brewery and Growler from Brewery. Pours an orange brown, with quickly dissipating head. Hop infused, for sure. Dry, with a slightly sour undertone. A good session Pale Ale, not the best I have had but solid nonetheless. The ambiance at the brewery is even better than the beer (which is good), so what are you doing reading this review. go the brewery and check it out!

Poured from a 32oz custom filled can at the brewery (awesome! you can get any of St bonifaces fine offerings custom filled on-the-spot in a 32 oz can). Muddy red pour with lots of tan head. Not much aroma. I am not a big red ale guy, but this one does the job. tons of toasty malt, not to be outdone by even more bitter hops. Very earthy, and a fair amount of alcohol tramples through. At 8% in a 32 oz can, a buzz bomb for sure. Not my favorite St Boniface offering, but recommended.

Growler from the Fridge, Lancaster. Thank you Tired Hands brewery, for sharing beer from what could possibly be the best brewery on the East Coast with us Lancastrians. Intense citrus Aroma upon opening growler. Pours a cloudy orange with almost no head. Palate full of buttery citrus, intensely strong fresh hops, but not overpowering bitterness. With a name like We are all Infinite...., the beer surprisingly matches the superlatives in its name. I am constantly seeking perfection in an IPA, this beer comes about as close to the 99th percentile as one can get. Wow.
beer_name: Tired Hands We Are All Infinite Energy Vibrating at the Same Frequency

review_blob:
On tap at BTS in DC. Hazy orange. Definitely hop forward but a bit astringent bitter bite. No prob with the bitterness but a bit harsh on the tongue. Decent, but does not rise to greatness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz can from whole foods foggy bottom dc. Love everything about this beer, from the indigo blue and yellow can, to the name of the beer. We
All want to escape to Colorado at some point, right. Pours slightly hazy earthy yellow nice hop aroma. At 6.2 ABV , it's a nice medium light hop refreshment. No can date (boo) but the beer is obviously fresh and delicious with an almost straight from the tap flavor. Wish I bought more than a 6er. Highly recommended 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I agree with the comments that this is a
Smooth ipa. And if a smooth ipa is what you are looking for, this is your beer. Nice aroma, pours a nice dark orange color, but the malt presence is a bit too heavy for my tastes. I prefer my beer lighter on the malt and more bitter. And hop forward . This IPA is not bitter. Nothing wrong with this ipa, just A matter of taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I'm rating this beer when I bought it 2 weeks after bottling. That being said I had a few left 6 months later and I am surprised how good a fresh hop beer can be 6 months after bottling. The biggest difference is the aroma, which as might be expected has decreased measurably to a 4 or 5 out of 10. Still I guess the high ABV and possibly the sugar from the honey (?) has prevented this ipa from getting that dreaded old stale flavor. Still a nice hoppy flavor and lots of hop oils on the tongue. Get a draft from the brewery next fall and you will be a happy camper.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Why do people who don't like hoppy beers rate double IPAs. It makes no sense to me. Pours a nice clear orange with lasting white head. 12 oz can. This is one of the best DIPAs I have had in a can. At somewhere around 8% ABV (the can does not say!), this wonderful product provides a reasonable alcohol level and very drinkable contents. Nice hop flavor with a medium hop balance. Very well done and recommended.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Delicious indeed.
Pours a beautiful slightly hazy yellow orange from a 12 oz bottle. This beer tastes very fresh considering it travelled from sunny CA to Lancaster PA. Definite lemon citrus and clean as a whistle. Very hoppy but not bitter. Rocks my world. Highly recommended. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark brown orange. A very malty IPA. A little too cloying and heavy for my taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 oz bomber. Skull wrapper indeed. Like the bottle says, a hop bomb without the imperial alcohol level. Pours a lighter yellow with nice foam. Brutally bitter, with a lasting oily bitterness long after. Nice citrus explosion . Good stuff and worth a try.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pint can from whole foods sb. This beer is heavier than I expected - I notice the wheat but honestly might not ID it if I didn't know it was a wheat beer - nice hop presence as advertised and I like the combo with wheat - an experiment that works well. Definitely worth a can or 4-pack to give it a try

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A wonderful Pale Ale. Very very dry and a delicious hop presence once it warms up. I would have a tough time finding an east coast pale ale that can top this. TONS of hops. I would really recommend this brewery (and Troegs in Hershey, for a totally different experience) to anyone visiting Central PA. The tasting room is so basic you know the beer is good.
Bomber. Nice Double IPA, very appealing hop citrus bomb with no strong cloying alcohol sweetness that double IPAs sometimes give. I really enjoyed this bomber. REcommended. .

Bomber from Brewery. Nice Citrus Aroma. Very dry and Hop Forward. Lots of Citrus. My only complaint is that it is a tad harsh, but I prefer it without too much malt sweetness. Very Clean and the 6% IPA definitely makes it more sessionable. A Great beer from a brewery that has improved by leaps and bounds over the past year. Recommended.

12
Oz bottle. Just released and bottled less than 2 weeks ago. Ipas are really about freshness and this delicious ipa is really fresh ! Lots of up front grapefruit and moderate ABV make this a very drinkable citrus sensation - highly recommended, especially this fresh!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 oz bomber from whole foods in foggy bottom, DC. this bomber was $5! the best $5 i ever spent.only negative was no sell by or use by date, but tasted very fresh. I just wish I would have gotten more than one bottle. really nice west coast citrus hop flavor. definitely hop-forward, but not over the top. very drinkable at 6.3% abv - the flavor suggested at least a one percent higher ABV. I really enjoyed this ipa and hope to find more. Very highly recommended.

I hate to give this beer a perfect score, buts lets face it, it is near perfect. I think the key is the bottled on date, which in my case was about 30 days ago. this beer, being bottle conditioned and very hoppy, does not age well. If you can get a bottle of this beer less than 60 days old, you will be drinking one of the best pale ales on the planet. Very hoppy and fresh, with the bottle-conditioned hazy yeast a near perfect beer. So addicting, I just wish they were less expensive.

22 oz bomber. Slightly astringent hop odor upon opening, not in a bad way though. Perfect West Coast IPA...I mean Pale ale. Really nice oily hop retention and mouthfeel.  Clean and crisp, really nice hop forward presentation, not too high on the ABV, but 10 times better than all those 4-5% "session" IPAs that are all the rage. a really great offering and highly recommended. up to green flashs usual high standards. makes me wish i lived in san diego.
beer_name: Green Flash Hop Odyssey 30th Street Pale Ale

review_blob: a nice balance of hops and malt, although a bit too malt-y, filling and full-bodied for my taste. still a nice flavor and slightly better than expected. not my favorite starr hill product, but pretty good.
This brew really raises the bar for what a black IPA should be. Not as malty and heavy as others. Medium lightness on the palate, full of hoppy flavor. Much better than expected.

12 oz can - heavy ipa - no date on can - might be old - somewhat unpleasant sour hop after taste. Not a fan

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very nice. clean, nice hop flavor, a bit oily, lots of citrus.  On the light side which is a nice complement to this beer. Recommended year-round drinking beer.
beer_name: Cigar City Hopped on the High Seas IPA (Hop #529)

review_blob: 12 oz Bottle from Hunger and Thirst, Lancaster. bottle date sometime in 2014 - date is smeared - so no more than 3 mo old. southern tier never disappoints and this is a good ipa. good but not great. decent aroma, high bitterness as might be expected. oily, with quite a bit of heaviness. very resiny, stays on your tongue long afterwards. I always enjoy trying southern tier products, but this is not one of my favorites.

Dunkin Donuts is marketing a donut for Easter right now that has a yellow marshmallow peep on top of a huge donut with artificially flavored and colored pink icing on top. I purchased one for my elderly mother because she always loved peeps. It had this really plastic-y odor that made me slightly nauseous. What does that have to do with a review of Eviltwin Molotov cocktail? Sometimes more is not better. I love IPAs with a passion. Many Imperial IPAs also manage to hide the alcohol with hops, which I applaud. This brew however, adds the yellow peep on top of the donut. What is the point. To say you drank a bottle and survived? I certainly did not enjoy this. Yes it blew up my mouth with alcohol and hops. But the alcohol took such control that I thought I was drinking an IPA with a shot of vodka. Not impressed.
